input: How do I make chocolate chip cookies?
output: To make chocolate chip cookies, you'll need: 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp salt, 1 cup butter, 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 3/4 cup brown sugar, 2 eggs, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 2 cups chocolate chips. Mix dry ingredients, cream butter and sugars, add eggs and vanilla, combine with flour mixture, fold in chocolate chips, drop by rounded tablespoons onto baking sheet, bake at 375°F for 9-11 minutes.

input: What ingredients do I need for chocolate chip cookies?
output: For chocolate chip cookies, you need: 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp salt, 1 cup butter (softened), 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 3/4 cup brown sugar, 2 eggs, 2 tsp vanilla extract, and 2 cups chocolate chips.

input: How long do chocolate chip cookies take to bake?
output: Chocolate chip cookies take 9-11 minutes to bake at 375°F. The total time including prep is about 30 minutes: 15 minutes prep time and 9-11 minutes bake time.

input: How do I make chicken stir fry?
output: To make chicken stir fry: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces, prepare vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots), make sauce with soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and sesame oil. Stir-fry chicken until golden, remove from pan, stir-fry vegetables, add sauce and chicken back, cook until sauce thickens. Serve over rice.

input: What sauce ingredients do I need for chicken stir fry?
output: For chicken stir fry sauce, you need: 1/4 cup soy sauce, 2 cloves minced garlic, 1 tbsp grated ginger, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 1/4 cup chicken broth, and 1 tbsp honey or brown sugar for sweetness.
